botanical_details.genus: Begonia can be annuals, evergreen or deciduous perennials or shrubs, with fibrous, tuberous or rhizomatous roots and usually asymmetrical leaves, often strikingly patterned, and small or large flowers, both male and female in the same cluster

how_to_grow.cultivation: Under glass requires a light, well-drained, neutral to acid, loamless or loam-based soil (JI No2), in bright light with shade from direct sun. Provide moderate water when in growth and dry off tubers in winter, storing at 5-7°C. See Begonias: outdoors for further advice.
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by seed at 21°C (70F) in spring. Root basal or stem-tip softwood cuttings in spring and leaf cuttings in late spring or early summer using a propagating case
how_to_grow.pruning: Remove old stems and foliage as plant dies back for the winter
how_to_grow.pests: Susceptible to mealybugs, caterpillars, glasshouse red spider mite, thrips, vine weevils and aphids
how_to_grow.diseases: Prone to powdery mildews and stem-rot
